zyklone.LEDCloud.patterns

Class LocalPattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • zyklone.LEDCloud.patterns.Pattern
      • zyklone.LEDCloud.patterns.LocalPattern
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DotPattern, WallPattern, WavePattern

    public abstract class LocalPattern
extends Pattern
    Represents a base class for variable patterns that only affect a part of whole picture. This is done by incorporating attributes like position, size, velocity, direction. The LocalPattern class provides all the base-functionality for calculating pictures depending on the set attributes, a subclass simply has to implement the drawPattern()-method to define the form of the pattern. Subclasses can directly access all of the attributes, but a constructor for initializing the most important attributes is provided nonetheless.
    Author:
    Zyklone

      • thickness

        protected int thickness
        Not necessarily applicable to all LocalPatterns

      • glow

        protected float glow
        The relative amount of brightness a spot should have, after the pattern leaves its position. This value is applied to the whole picture (which then represents the faded, old picture), before the next picture is calculated and applied to the old one.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LocalPattern

        public LocalPattern(int pictureSizeX,
                    int pictureSizeY)
        This constructor initializes all the attributes to default values which are configured for DotPattern, but could be used for any other LocalPattern as well.
        Parameters:
        pictureSizeX - the length in the x-axis of the led-matrix
        pictureSizeY - the length in the y-axis of the led-matrix

      • LocalPattern

        public LocalPattern(int pictureSizeX,
                    int pictureSizeY,
                    int maxLifetimeInMs,
                    java.lang.Integer maxSize,
                    java.lang.Float maxVelocity,
                    java.lang.Float maxAcceleration,
                    java.lang.Float averageGlow)
        This constructor allows the passed parameters to set most of the object's attributes. If a null value is passed, the corresponding attributes are set to null (except for the size, which would be initialized with a default value). If an invalid value is passed, the corresponding attributes are initialized with default values.
        Parameters:
        pictureSizeX - the length in the x-axis of the led-matrix
        pictureSizeY - the length in the y-axis of the led-matrix
        maxLifetimeInMs - the maximum lifetime the instance of this class should have
        maxSize - the maximum size this pattern should have
        maxVelocity - the the maximum velocity this pattern should have
        maxAcceleration - the the maximum acceleration this pattern should have
        averageGlow - a rough value of the amount of glow this pattern should have

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        Initializes the coordinates with random values inside the picture.

      • setColor

        private void setColor()
        Sets the Pattern's color to a pseudo-random value.

      • setBackgroundPatternColor

        protected void setBackgroundPatternColor()
        Sets the Pattern's color to a very low, pseudo-random value with a heavy blue tone, so it can be used in a BackgroundPattern.

      • drawPattern

        protected abstract void drawPattern()
        Defines how to draw the pattern, i.e. the form of the pattern.

      • getNextPicture

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Color>> getNextPicture()
        Calculates and returns the next picture. The new position of the pattern is dependent on the time passed since the last calculation.
        Specified by:
        getNextPicture in class Pattern
        Returns:
        the last calculated picture of this pattern.

      • updateDirectionChange

        protected void updateDirectionChange()
        Randomly sets the value of the directionChange-attribute to a value between -0.3 and 0.3 PI

      • fadeInPicture

        protected void fadeInPicture()
        Gradually fades in the last calculated picture, depending on the time that passed since the creation of the pattern. Full brightness is reached after 1 second.

      • fadeOutPicture

        protected void fadeOutPicture()
        Fades out the last calculated picture. If the remaining lifetime is longer than 1 second, the standard glow-setting will be applied. If the remaining lifetime is shorter than 1 second, the picture is set to gradually fade out to zero over the remaining lifetime.

      • drawPixel

        protected void drawPixel(int x,
                         int y)
        Sets exactly one pixel of the picture, based on the objects color-attribute. Checks if the passed coordinates are within the picture-size and corrects the values if not. Coordinates crossing the y-boundary, reappear on the opposite side Coordinates crossing the x-boundary, reappear on the same side, mirrored on the line y=pictureSizeY/2
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the pixel
        y - the y-coordinate of the pixel

      • updateAcceleration

        protected void updateAcceleration()
        Pseudo-randomly generates an acceleration value. Generally the acceleration will not exceed the maxAcceleration value, unless the current velocity is above or below a certain absolute value, in which case the generated acceleration value may exceed the maxAccleration value by up to 50%.

      • advancePatternCoordinates

        protected void advancePatternCoordinates()
        Calculates and sets the pattern's new position, depending on the time passed between the last calculation and the pattern's velocity.
